subtitle: Your baby loves to play
title: 3 months old
content:
Created by BabyCenter 


Your baby is getting more flexible. He may enjoy opening and closing his fingers, or clapping his hands.

Your baby's sense of humor is developing, too. A tickle or a noisy kiss on his tummy will likely make him chuckle. 

Right from birth, your baby loves being touched. It's important for his growth and development. A massage after a bath or a nice long cuddle before bed will be good for both of you. 

Just playing helps your baby's brain grow. As his brain develops, he is getting more curious. He may play with a small toy that he can hold and shake. He will be learning about color, shape and size, too. He also learns from the noise a toy makes and from feeling if it is soft or hard.	

Your baby will start to giggle and smile when you make funny faces and he will enjoy lots of silliness. He will also enjoy hearing lots of sounds. Click your tongue, whistle or make animal noises. He will love it.

[Your 3-months-old's development][1]


  [1]: http://www.babycenter.com/0_your-3-month-olds-development_718.bc
